instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: a 3476 macbook pro it has the orange light on the charger and all the rails are present except SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Can you explain what is the problem with this board?
No video, no USB activity???
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
The actual problem is that SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN on pin2 of Q5480 is missing
Q5480 pin 3 is 0v, p4 12.58v and p5 12.4 and p6 12.58

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
"No video, no USB activity???
Try to start in SMC bypass mode."

The board is working and only missing SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN???

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: no the board doesn't turn on. and these two rails are missing PP1V35_S3 and SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: Ok you have way more than missing SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN forget about that rail. Voltage on PPBUS_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H, PP5v_S5, PP3v3_S5, PP3v3_SUS, PP5v_S4 present???

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
You've fixed the atention in something irrelevant at this point...

"and all the rails are present"
Post the ALL then...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Thanks for your replay al these rails are present
PPBUS_G3H
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V
PP3V42_G3H
PPVRTC_G3H

PP5V_S4

PP3V3_S4
PP3V3_SUS
PP3V3_S3

PP1V05_SUS

and these rails are missing:

PP3V3_S4SW_SNS
PP1V35_S3
PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR
PPVTTDDR_S3

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: Exact voltage on PPBUS_G3H???

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: ppbus_g3h is 8.85v

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
"8.85v"
Do you mean 8.58V???

"PP3V3_S4SW_SNS
PP1V35_S3
PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR
PPVTTDDR_S3"
You've posted other S4/3 voltages as present; so these ones should also be present.
Check for short on any of them.
An o-scope should help to catch a pulse at least, if present...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: I checked for a short but there is no short on these rails

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Start then to check powers and enable for all these S3 supplies which don't deliver tension.
PM_SLP_S4_L is present, but some resistors derivate this signal to enable various supplies.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: could it be that Q5480 gone bad? because i get nothing on pin 1/2/3 and only on P4 12.58v p5 12.45 and p6  12.33v

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
When you have doubt about any sensor, try to start on SMC bypass.
As you got S4 voltages, board is starting.
Check if all coils pulse at least.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Sorry but could you please tel me how to bypass SMC?
Thanks alot

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: [url]https://www.google.com/search?q=start+smc+bypass&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&client=firefox-b-ab[/url]

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: the board doesn't turn on at all. how can I bypass the SMC?

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Bypass SMC reffers to a way to start the board disabling SMC sensors.
And is explained in the results of the link above mentioned.
Press power button, plugin the charger and maintain power button pressed 5-10s...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Dear Sir thanks for your replay and I apologize if I ask a silly question time by time, Please take into consideration that board repair is not what I do for living it is my hobby and I'm not learning it on other peoples machines I bought couple of defect macbook/ macbook pro ( these are not donor boards and fixable ) and I'm trying to get them fixed.
and I really do appreciate your time and effort.
And I wish you a very nice weekend ahead.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
No problem, you can get help here anytime you need.
Happy weekend too...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Thanks a lot for your understanding.
the PP3v3_S4 is present but pp3_v3_s4sw_sns and PP1V35_S3 are missing.
you suggested to check the S3 supplies to see which one is not creating tension,
S3 supplies are the same as S3 switches? where the S3 rail gets created?
when I measure the resistance  on R2221 I get 0,558 kilo ohm but it should be 1kohm

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is required for the SMC sensors.
Did you try SMC bypass?

S3 supplies should be controlled by PM_SLP_S4_L.
S0 supplies are controlled by PM_SLP_S3_L.
Take a look at page 61.

Measure a resistor onboard, when is connected with other components, is not the best idea.
There are more resistors with similar value; te result will be lower value...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Dear Sir it turns on when I bypass the SMC and fan spins very fast. but no image
what should I do next?

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Do you have USB activity?
Connect an USB mouse, and reconnect it when board is on; let see if gets light.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: the USB is active and I get light even when I disconnect and connect it to the board

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Seems that board boots in SMC bypass.
No image, nor backlight?
Try external monitor too.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: no unfortunately nothing on external monitor not via HDMI nor Thunderbolt

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Will be better to test USB with external OSX.
Need pendrive, or HDD adapter with link LED.
If flashes, means USB activity for sure; mouse can get confused.

Post values for chgr_amon and chgr_bmon, whitout starting in bypass mode.
SMC_AVREF voltage is present?

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
chgr_amon is 0.089v and chgr_bmon is 0.1V
I can't. find any the SMC_AVREF not in the schematics nor board view.
I tested with an external HDD the lights burns

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
"SMC_AVREF not in the schematics"
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC

Post SMC_DCIN_VSENSE and PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
SMC_DCIN_VSENSE is 2.5v and PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL is 17.05v
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC is 3.29

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN only appears in S0 state.
So there should be something else which blocks the SMC in S5 state; could be some bad solders.
Reball SMC; if no result, change it...

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message: I have noticed that the SSD gets worm when it's connected to the board and also when it's connected I see that the power supply uses 0.1 amp and when I disconnect the ssd from the board than amperage drops back to 0.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Check PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FET.
It should not be present in S5 state.
If you get voltage there, change U8070.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
Could you please help me understanding one thing,
As I understood from your previews explanations 5 volt rail and 3v rail are created by the same component. and an other component ( the SMC i think ) decides which state should become enable ( S5,S4,S3 and S0). Am I correct?
An other thing is that first AL S5 rails must be working than the board can go to the next state I mean without S5 there will be no S4 and S3?
for example if the 5v is present but only in S5 and not present in PP5_V5_S3 than it mean's that there is something on S3 rail gone bad and sends the 5v to the ground or blocks the 5v.

I'm really really great full and appreciate your help and effort.

threads.title: 820-3476 macbook pro
threads.message:
A direct short to ground is easy to confirm; doesn't even need to power up the board.
But a short, or overcurrent, can drop a voltage (S3 for example) only when that power rail is enabled.

Immediately after charger is plugged in, board goes from G3 (mechanical off) state to G2-S5 state.
G2 contains S5 to S0 states.
To exit from S5, PM_SLP_S5_L must be disabled; that means to go high, be aware of _L from the end of name!!!
Many times PM_SLP_S4_L is used instead of S5 one...
Anyone of these signals will let the board in S3 state; also known as Suspend to RAM.
To achieve full working state (S0), PM_SLP_S3_L should go high (disabled).

S4 is known as Suspend to HDD sometime.

BTW, 5V_S5 line from MacBooks is a low power line.
5V high power line appears in S4, or S3 state; on the corresponding big coil.
